string: ACT I
SCENE I. Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
Enter THESEUS, HIPPOLYTA, PHILOSTRATE, and Attendants
THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

string: Now, fair Hippolyta, our nuptial hour
speaker: THESEUS

string: Draws on apace; four happy days bring in
speaker: THESEUS

string: Another moon: but, O, methinks, how slow
speaker: THESEUS

string: This old moon wanes! she lingers my desires,
speaker: THESEUS

string: Like to a step-dame or a dowager
speaker: THESEUS

string: Long withering out a young man revenue.
speaker: THESEUS

string: HIPPOLYTA
speaker: HIPPOLYTA

string: Four days will quickly steep themselves in night;
speaker: HIPPOLYTA

string: Four nights will quickly dream away the time;
speaker: HIPPOLYTA

string: And then the moon, like to a silver bow
speaker: HIPPOLYTA

string: New-bent in heaven, shall behold the night
speaker: HIPPOLYTA

string: Of our solemnities.
speaker: HIPPOLYTA

string: THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

string: Go, Philostrate,
speaker: THESEUS

string: Stir up the Athenian youth to merriments;
speaker: THESEUS

string: Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth;
speaker: THESEUS

string: Turn melancholy forth to funerals;
speaker: THESEUS

string: The pale companion is not for our pomp.
speaker: THESEUS

string: Exit PHILOSTRATE
Hippolyta, I woo'd thee with my sword,
speaker: THESEUS

string: And won thy love, doing thee injuries;
speaker: THESEUS

string: But I will wed thee in another key,
speaker: THESEUS

string: With pomp, with triumph and with revelling.
speaker: THESEUS

string: Enter EGEUS, HERMIA, LYSANDER, and DEMETRIUS
EGEUS
speaker: EGEUS

string: Happy be Theseus, our renowned duke!
speaker: EGEUS

string: THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

string: Thanks, good Egeus: what's the news with thee?
speaker: THESEUS

string: EGEUS
speaker: EGEUS

string: Full of vexation come I, with complaint
speaker: EGEUS

string: Against my child, my daughter Hermia.
speaker: EGEUS

string: Stand forth, Demetrius. My noble lord,
speaker: EGEUS

string: This man hath my consent to marry her.
speaker: EGEUS

string: Stand forth, Lysander: and my gracious duke,
speaker: EGEUS

string: This man hath bewitch'd the bosom of my child;
speaker: EGEUS

string: Thou, thou, Lysander, thou hast given her rhymes,
speaker: EGEUS

string: And interchanged love-tokens with my child:
speaker: EGEUS

string: Thou hast by moonlight at her window sung,
speaker: EGEUS

string: With feigning voice verses of feigning love,
speaker: EGEUS

string: And stolen the impression of her fantasy
speaker: EGEUS

string: With bracelets of thy hair, rings, gawds, conceits,
speaker: EGEUS

string: Knacks, trifles, nosegays, sweetmeats, messengers
speaker: EGEUS

string: Of strong prevailment in unharden'd youth:
speaker: EGEUS

string: With cunning hast thou filch'd my daughter's heart,
speaker: EGEUS

string: Turn'd her obedience, which is due to me,
speaker: EGEUS

string: To stubborn harshness: and, my gracious duke,
speaker: EGEUS

string: Be it so she; will not here before your grace
speaker: EGEUS

string: Consent to marry with Demetrius,
speaker: EGEUS

string: I beg the ancient privilege of Athens,
speaker: EGEUS

string: As she is mine, I may dispose of her:
speaker: EGEUS

string: Which shall be either to this gentleman
speaker: EGEUS

string: Or to her death, according to our law
speaker: EGEUS

string: Immediately provided in that case.
speaker: EGEUS

string: THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

string: What say you, Hermia? be advised fair maid:
speaker: THESEUS

string: To you your father should be as a god;
speaker: THESEUS

string: One that composed your beauties, yea, and one
speaker: THESEUS

speaker: THESEUS

string: By him imprinted and within his power
speaker: THESEUS

string: To leave the figure or disfigure it.
speaker: THESEUS

string: Demetrius is a worthy gentleman.
speaker: THESEUS

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: So is Lysander.
speaker: HERMIA

string: THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

string: In himself he is;
speaker: THESEUS

speaker: THESEUS

string: The other must be held the worthier.
speaker: THESEUS

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: I would my father look'd but with my eyes.
speaker: HERMIA

string: THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

speaker: THESEUS

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: I do entreat your grace to pardon me.
speaker: HERMIA

string: I know not by what power I am made bold,
speaker: HERMIA

string: Nor how it may concern my modesty,
speaker: HERMIA

string: In such a presence here to plead my thoughts;
speaker: HERMIA

string: But I beseech your grace that I may know
speaker: HERMIA

string: The worst that may befall me in this case,
speaker: HERMIA

string: If I refuse to wed Demetrius.
speaker: HERMIA

string: THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

string: Either to die the death or to abjure
speaker: THESEUS

string: For ever the society of men.
speaker: THESEUS

string: Therefore, fair Hermia, question your desires;
speaker: THESEUS

string: Know of your youth, examine well your blood,
speaker: THESEUS

string: Whether, if you yield not to your father's choice,
speaker: THESEUS

string: You can endure the livery of a nun,
speaker: THESEUS

string: For aye to be in shady cloister mew'd,
speaker: THESEUS

string: To live a barren sister all your life,
speaker: THESEUS

string: Chanting faint hymns to the cold fruitless moon.
speaker: THESEUS

string: Thrice-blessed they that master so their blood,
speaker: THESEUS

string: To undergo such maiden pilgrimage;
speaker: THESEUS

string: But earthlier happy is the rose distill'd,
speaker: THESEUS

string: Than that which withering on the virgin thorn
speaker: THESEUS

string: Grows, lives and dies in single blessedness.
speaker: THESEUS

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: So will I grow, so live, so die, my lord,
speaker: HERMIA

string: Ere I will my virgin patent up
speaker: HERMIA

string: Unto his lordship, whose unwished yoke
speaker: HERMIA

string: My soul consents not to give sovereignty.
speaker: HERMIA

string: THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

string: Take time to pause; and, by the next new moon--
speaker: THESEUS

string: The sealing-day betwixt my love and me,
speaker: THESEUS

string: For everlasting bond of fellowship--
speaker: THESEUS

string: Upon that day either prepare to die
speaker: THESEUS

string: For disobedience to your father's will,
speaker: THESEUS

string: Or else to wed Demetrius, as he would;
speaker: THESEUS

string: Or on Diana's altar to protest
speaker: THESEUS

string: For aye austerity and single life.
speaker: THESEUS

string: DEMETRIUS
speaker: DEMETRIUS

string: Relent, sweet Hermia: and, Lysander, yield
speaker: DEMETRIUS

string: Thy crazed title to my certain right.
speaker: DEMETRIUS

string: LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

string: You have her father's love, Demetrius;
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Let me have Hermia's: do you marry him.
speaker: LYSANDER

string: EGEUS
speaker: EGEUS

string: Scornful Lysander! true, he hath my love,
speaker: EGEUS

string: And what is mine my love shall render him.
speaker: EGEUS

string: And she is mine, and all my right of her
speaker: EGEUS

string: I do estate unto Demetrius.
speaker: EGEUS

string: LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

string: I am, my lord, as well derived as he,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: As well possess'd; my love is more than his;
speaker: LYSANDER

string: My fortunes every way as fairly rank'd,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: If not with vantage, as Demetrius';
speaker: LYSANDER

string: And, which is more than all these boasts can be,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: I am beloved of beauteous Hermia:
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Why should not I then prosecute my right?
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Demetrius, I'll avouch it to his head,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Made love to Nedar's daughter, Helena,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: And won her soul; and she, sweet lady, dotes,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Devoutly dotes, dotes in idolatry,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Upon this spotted and inconstant man.
speaker: LYSANDER

string: THESEUS
speaker: THESEUS

string: I must confess that I have heard so much,
speaker: THESEUS

string: And with Demetrius thought to have spoke thereof;
speaker: THESEUS

string: But, being over-full of self-affairs,
speaker: THESEUS

string: My mind did lose it. But, Demetrius, come;
speaker: THESEUS

string: And come, Egeus; you shall go with me,
speaker: THESEUS

string: I have some private schooling for you both.
speaker: THESEUS

string: For you, fair Hermia, look you arm yourself
speaker: THESEUS

string: To fit your fancies to your father's will;
speaker: THESEUS

string: Or else the law of Athens yields you up--
speaker: THESEUS

string: Which by no means we may extenuate--
speaker: THESEUS

string: To death, or to a vow of single life.
speaker: THESEUS

string: Come, my Hippolyta: what cheer, my love?
speaker: THESEUS

string: Demetrius and Egeus, go along:
speaker: THESEUS

string: I must employ you in some business
speaker: THESEUS

string: Against our nuptial and confer with you
speaker: THESEUS

string: Of something nearly that concerns yourselves.
speaker: THESEUS

string: EGEUS
speaker: EGEUS

string: With duty and desire we follow you.
speaker: EGEUS

string: Exeunt all but LYSANDER and HERMIA
LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

string: How now, my love! why is your cheek so pale?
speaker: LYSANDER

string: How chance the roses there do fade so fast?
speaker: LYSANDER

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: Belike for want of rain, which I could well
speaker: HERMIA

string: Beteem them from the tempest of my eyes.
speaker: HERMIA

string: LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Ay me! for aught that I could ever read,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Could ever hear by tale or history,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: The course of true love never did run smooth;
speaker: LYSANDER

string: But, either it was different in blood,--
speaker: LYSANDER

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: O cross! too high to be enthrall'd to low.
speaker: HERMIA

string: LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Or else misgraffed in respect of years,--
speaker: LYSANDER

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: O spite! too old to be engaged to young.
speaker: HERMIA

string: LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,--
speaker: LYSANDER

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: O hell! to choose love by another's eyes.
speaker: HERMIA

string: LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Or, if there were a sympathy in choice,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: War, death, or sickness did lay siege to it,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Making it momentany as a sound,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Swift as a shadow, short as any dream;
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Brief as the lightning in the collied night,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: That, in a spleen, unfolds both heaven and earth,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: And ere a man hath power to say 'Behold!'
speaker: LYSANDER

string: The jaws of darkness do devour it up:
speaker: LYSANDER

string: So quick bright things come to confusion.
speaker: LYSANDER

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: If then true lovers have been ever cross'd,
speaker: HERMIA

string: It stands as an edict in destiny:
speaker: HERMIA

string: Then let us teach our trial patience,
speaker: HERMIA

string: Because it is a customary cross,
speaker: HERMIA

string: As due to love as thoughts and dreams and sighs,
speaker: HERMIA

string: Wishes and tears, poor fancy's followers.
speaker: HERMIA

string: LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

string: A good persuasion: therefore, hear me, Hermia.
speaker: LYSANDER

string: I have a widow aunt, a dowager
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Of great revenue, and she hath no child:
speaker: LYSANDER

string: From Athens is her house remote seven leagues;
speaker: LYSANDER

string: And she respects me as her only son.
speaker: LYSANDER

string: There, gentle Hermia, may I marry thee;
speaker: LYSANDER

string: And to that place the sharp Athenian law
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Cannot pursue us. If thou lovest me then,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Steal forth thy father's house to-morrow night;
speaker: LYSANDER

string: And in the wood, a league without the town,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: Where I did meet thee once with Helena,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: To do observance to a morn of May,
speaker: LYSANDER

string: There will I stay for thee.
speaker: LYSANDER

string: HERMIA
speaker: HERMIA

string: My good Lysander!

speaker: HERMIA

string: By his best arrow with the golden head,

speaker: HERMIA

string: LYSANDER
speaker: LYSANDER

speaker: OBERON

string: Nor mark prodigious, such as are
speaker: OBERON

string: Despised in nativity,
speaker: OBERON

string: Shall upon their children be.
speaker: OBERON

string: With this field-dew consecrate,
speaker: OBERON

string: Every fairy take his gait;
speaker: OBERON

string: And each several chamber bless,
speaker: OBERON

string: Through this palace, with sweet peace;
speaker: OBERON

string: And the owner of it blest
speaker: OBERON

string: Ever shall in safety rest.
speaker: OBERON

string: Trip away; make no stay;
speaker: OBERON

string: Meet me all by break of day.
speaker: OBERON

string: Exeunt OBERON, TITANIA, and train
PUCK
speaker: PUCK

string: If we shadows have offended,
speaker: PUCK

string: Think but this, and all is mended,
speaker: PUCK

string: That you have but slumber'd here
speaker: PUCK

string: While these visions did appear.
speaker: PUCK

string: And this weak and idle theme,
speaker: PUCK

string: No more yielding but a dream,
speaker: PUCK

string: Gentles, do not reprehend:
speaker: PUCK

string: if you pardon, we will mend:
speaker: PUCK

string: And, as I am an honest Puck,
speaker: PUCK

string: If we have unearned luck
speaker: PUCK

string: Now to 'scape the serpent's tongue,
speaker: PUCK

string: We will make amends ere long;
speaker: PUCK

string: Else the Puck a liar call;
speaker: PUCK

string: So, good night unto you all.
speaker: PUCK

string: Give me your hands, if we be friends,
speaker: PUCK

string: And Robin shall restore amends.
speaker: PUCK
